thread.title: Union Minister Amit Shah Seeks Divine Blessings at Lord Venkateswara Temple | Entertainment
thread.title_full: Union Minister Amit Shah Seeks Divine Blessings at Lord Venkateswara Temple | Entertainment

author: PTI
title: Union Minister Amit Shah Seeks Divine Blessings at Lord Venkateswara Temple | Entertainment
text: Union Minister Amit Shah Seeks Divine Blessings at Lord Venkateswara Temple Union Home Minister Amit Shah visited the Lord Venkateswara temple in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. Accompanied by his wife Sonal Shah, Amit Shah participated in the rituals and received blessings from the temple priests. The visit follows another prayer offering at Kottai Bhairavar temple in Tamil Nadu. [PTI](/pti-stories)| Tirupati | Updated: 31-05-2024 12:10 IST | Created: 31-05-2024 12:10 IST - Country: - India Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at Lord Venkateswara temple here on Friday, said an official. Accompanied by his wife Sonal Shah, the BJP leader reached the temple at around 8 am and spent half an hour there, participating in the rituals. ''The temple priests blessed Shah and also gifted him a diary, ayurvedic products, laddu (consecrated sweet) and other items,'' the official told PTI. On Thursday, Shah offered prayers at the Kottai Bhairavar temple in Pudukkottai in Tamil Nadu. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
